intro: Rapanea apoensis, commonly known as the Philippine holly, is a flowering plant species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a small, dark berry that contains seeds. Rapanea apoensis is often found in lowland and montane forests, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
